content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"^```julia\n((?:\s|[^\n])*)```"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Loop through each match of the Julia code block regex
    for m in eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)
        # Get the captured group with the actual code
        code = String(m.captures[1])

        # Remove the leading and trailing whitespace from the code
        code = strip(code)

        # Append the code to the extracted code string
        extracted_code *= "\n" * code
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown document `md` as a string and uses a regular expression to find all instances of Julia code blocks. It then strips the leading and trailing whitespace from each block and joins them together with a newline. Finally, it returns the combined code as a string.
